Dear doctorsI want your advice for my mother condition :She is 83 year old with a history of 15-20 years of diabetes , insulin dependent and her blood sugar level was controlled most of the time .Accidentally she was diagnosed to have a sellar meningioma in 2002 , on those day she start having back pain , for which she visit an Orthoped , and he request for an dorsal vertebral MRI , but my mother requested to have an MRI from brain and whole vertebrate......On that day we find out that she has meningioma and some disc problem on L3-L4and L5A neurosurgeon advise us not to operate the meningioma because of the risk factor as it cover one of the main artery on the brain , he suggest radiation or observationAfter discussing with radio therapist and find out the possible side effect , we decide to observe it , she has no any symptom related to meningioma , just very mild visual field defect , and on yearly MRI the size remain stable , she always complain of back pain and radiating to her feet , and doctors advise to tolerate and give him some NSAID medication along with her treatment for diabetes until last year which she developed some sphincter control and mild paresthesia in her feet , and one neurosurgeon did laminectomy for her on September 2013 next day after surgery she developed left side seizure and she was asking where am I and for what we are here , her doctor suspect to have a CVA , , ct scan did not show any thingNext day after that she was ok , she had no pain any more , but still she could not walk properly , doctor advise rehab and physiotherapy for almost a month which had no effect on her , gradually her gait get worse , but the movment of her feet was normal when she lay on the bed and she had no sign of diabetic neuropathy ,Suspect to have a cerebral problem , MRI  shows temporal brain atrophy , 4th ventricle enlargement , and hydrocephalus ...With this doctor diagnosed as vascular dementia , and prescribed for her 3 mg of exelon daily , her memory is not bad  for her age , she can not control her urine , and her main problem is walking which get worse day by day , fortunately her mood is ok , she is on exelon , alsexia , esitalopram (cipralex)  14 unit of insuline , plavix vitamine B1My question from you is that  is this dementia ? Could it be due to her meningioma , or side effect of surgery and anesthesia  ?What  medecine is going to help her ?If the reason is meningioma , could radiotherapy help her ?
